locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the character of God as a welcoming Father rather than a harsh judge, using the parable of the sheep and goats and the prodigal father to emphasize God's proactive invitation and provision.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher uses a thematic approach, weaving together various biblical images (Sinai, parables, Psalms) to construct a character study of God.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily seeks to reassure the hearer of God's kindness, moving from describing God's nature to inviting the hearer to trust that nature.
voorbeelden: Jesus does not support this idea.
He wants us to come close.
Stand close, believer, it is all right.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort, relief of fear, and a sense of security in God's presence.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the 'event'.

voorbeelden: Many people think of God as a harsh figure.
Jesus recognized that at its heart, life has a kindness.
The Lord has made provisions.
Never let the mood of abandonment own you.
Take thy cross.
Lift up thine eyes.
We bow in awe and reverence.
I'm not so afraid now.
He will teach us his ways.
There will be waiting for us... the mighty hand of God.
He will [lead us].
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in the character of God, though often phrased as future-tense certainties rather than direct 'I promise you' speech acts.

voorbeelden: Stand close, believer, it is all right.
You need not be [afraid].
It is safe and pleasant close to God.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher assumes a pastoral authority to declare a state of safety for the hearer based on the text.

indicatoren: Historical descriptions of how people 'used to think'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives a compelling lecture on the kindness of God but may remain an observer of the truth rather than a participant in it.

missende_elementen: Direct sacramental 'I' address from God to the 'You' of the congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of 'aboutness' that requires the hearer to make the final bridge to their own life.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High emotional resonance, though often mediated through the 3rd person ('He will').
voorbeelden: The Lord has prepared for us.
He will [lead us] through.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for personal anecdotes (Martha) and inclusive 'we' to build rapport.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the 'believer' and 'you' in the final third of the sermon.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the comfort of the Gospel directly.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the exegetical and illustrative sections.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'teaching' atmosphere for the first half.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from Assertive (God is kind) to Declarative (It is safe) to Commissive (He will lead you).
voorbeelden: He spreads the table... He bids us welcome.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is smooth and pastorally effective, though heavily reliant on the preacher's descriptive power.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Inherit! ... We are our Father's children.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a powerful reassurance of God's character, successfully moving from 'talking about' God to 'bringing' the hearer to God by the end.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The discussion of Prometheus and Greek deities.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Takes up significant space describing what God is NOT, delaying the performative event.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final movement where the preacher stops explaining and starts welcoming.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strong on the 'Toezegging' (Promise), but slightly weak on the 'Declarative' (the actual 'I forgive/bless you' moment).

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the 'Stand close, believer' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: Oh, how you and I need to hear God saying to us...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's response.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the vehicle for the invitation.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, the imagery of the lighted altar.
tekstueel_bewijs: As we came toward the lighted altar... I'm not so afraid now.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertives). It needs more 'I' (God) to 'You' (Hearer) performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus says that God gives to us the perfect invitation.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Hear Jesus now: He invites you, 'Come, you who are blessed!''
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a report about an invitation to the delivery of the invitation itself.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Make the promise specific to the 'fiery trials' mentioned.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you in the valley this week, God promises: I will lead you through.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' more frequently in the middle section.
voorbeeldzinnen: You do not have to steal your happiness from a reluctant God.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: The balance is already quite good.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply pastoral sermon that successfully navigates the shift from information to encounter, though it could be even more 'event-like' by reducing the constative surplus in the introduction.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies the 'Declarative' power (changing the hearer's status before God) which SvT's psychological model would miss.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The focus is not on the preacher's pathos, but on the illocutionary force of God's promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final 20% where the speech acts shift from Assertive to Commissive.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Stand close, believer, it is all right.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it changes the hearer's perceived reality.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Invitation' as a performative hook, but spends a long time explaining the invitation before actually extending it.
